StoryText: My father is working on a project in the garage and needs my help. He says he needs to get a nail into the wall.
Question: What do I give him?

OptionResult.Result: He thanks me for the hammer and is glad I knew the right tool that he needed. He shows me what he’s working on and we bond.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: My father and I have a great time bonding while he worked on his project and it was a great way to spend a few hours.

OptionResult.Result: He gets mad at me because it’s the wrong tool and tells me I need to stay and watch him work to learn a thing or two.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: My father definitely got annoyed with me and I got annoyed with him, but I did actually learn a bit about what he was doing. So, it wasn’t a total loss of a day.

OptionResult.Result: He sighs because it’s the wrong tooL. He is annoyed but tells me to go back in the house. I go in and watch TV.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: My father was irritated I could tell, but it’s not my fault I don’t know about this stuff. Anyway, I was happy to not have to help him and be able to watch TV.

OptionResult.Result: He laughs and tells me he needs a hammer and then decides to teach me some things about what he’s doing.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: My father and I had a good time actually even though I had no idea what he was doing at first. But he taught me a lot!
